title: Naor Gilon
text:
Naor Gilon (<a href="hebrew">hebrew</a>: נאור גילאון) is the current <a href="List%20of%20ambassadors%20of%20Israel%20to%20the%20Netherlands">ambassador of Israel to the Netherlands</a>, incoming <a href="List%20of%20Ambassadors%20of%20Israel%20to%20India">ambassador of Israel to India</a>, and former <a href="List%20of%20ambassadors%20of%20Israel%20to%20Italy">ambassador of Israel to Italy</a> and to <a href="San%20Marino">San Marino</a> (Feb 2012 – Aug 2016).
Biography.
Naor Gilon was born in Israel. He received his <a href="Bachelor%27s%20degree">BA</a> in political science at <a href="Tel%20Aviv%20University">Tel Aviv University</a> and his Master's degree <a href="summa%20cum%20laude">summa cum laude</a> in international relations at <a href="Corvinus%20University%20of%20Budapest">Corvinus University of Budapest</a>. He is married with four children.
Diplomatic career.
Gilon joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1989 and served as the deputy chief of missions at the Embassy of Israel in Hungary (1990–1995), deputy foreign policy advisor to the prime minister (1995–1997), counselor for political affairs at the permanent mission to the United Nations (1997–2000), and as director of the Division for Strategic and Military Affairs in the Center for Policy Research in Ministry of Foreign Affairs (2000–2002).
As a minister-counselor for political affairs at the Embassy of Israel in <a href="Washington%2C%20D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a>, he was the subject of <a href="Federal%20Bureau%20of%20Investigation">FBI</a> investigations into the <a href="Lawrence%20Franklin%20espionage%20scandal">Lawrence Franklin espionage scandal</a>, which involved the leaking of classified information by an employee at the <a href="United%20States%20Department%20of%20Defense">United States Department of Defense</a>.
According to Israeli journalist <a href="Shmuel%20Rosner">Shmuel Rosner</a>, Gilon's return to the U.S. in late 2005 was an indication that "no serious allegations concerning Israel's involvement in the <a href="American%20Israel%20Public%20Affairs%20Committee">American Israel Public Affairs Committee</a> (AIPAC) affair still exist."
In 2009, he served as the chief of staff to <a href="Ministry%20of%20Foreign%20Affairs%20%28Israel%29">Minister of Foreign Affairs</a> <a href="Avigdor%20Lieberman">Avigdor Lieberman</a> and as the deputy director general for Western Europe division at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 2009 to 2011
In 2021, it was announced that he would be the new <a href="List%20of%20Ambassadors%20of%20Israel%20to%20India">ambassador of Israel to India</a>.
